arts.ttl: A big opportunity for Milan Futuro product Bartesaghi as he could start vs Juventus
arts.sum: Today’s edition of Tuttosport headlines the following words: “Bartesaghi, the first product of Milan Futuro.” In yesterday’s press conference, Max Allegri tried to keep the competition open between Davide Bartesaghi and Zachary Athekame for tonight’s match at Juventus’ home ground, but there seem to be few doubts that the Italian full-back will take the place […]

arts.ttl: Capello breaks Juventus-Milan down into three crucial tactical aspects
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher Fabio Capello has provided a fascinating tactical breakdown of tonight’s game between Juventus and AC Milan. Any game that pits the Bianconeri against the Rossoneri is one that carries a bit of added drama, given the long-standing rivalry between the two biggest clubs in Italian football. However, tonight there is a bit of added spice: […] The post Capello breaks Juventus-Milan down into three crucial tactical aspects appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: CorSera: Sticking with a winning formula – Allegri opts against changes vs. Juventus
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher Massimiliano Allegri has made his decisions regarding who will start for AC Milan, and he will stick to the old adage of not changing a winning team. As Corriere della Sera (via MilanNews) reports this morning, Allegri will confirm the same starting line-up for the big match away to Juventus that he fielded a week […] The post CorSera: Sticking with a winning formula – Allegri opts against changes vs. Juventus appeared first on SempreMilan.

arts.ttl: GdS: ‘A spectacle’ – how Allegri has prepared Milan for his Juventus return
arts.sum: By: Oliver Fisher This won’t be an ordinary night for Massimiliano Allegri, who returns to face Juventus, a club that he knows better than most. As La Gazzetta dello Sport (seen below) recall, Allegri tried to hide his feelings in his pre-match press conference, explaining that ‘every time I sit on the bench, it’s a thrill for me’. arts.ttl: Milan lean on Modric and Rabiot to punish Juventus’ midfield
arts.sum: The midfield is the area making the difference for Milan. Partly because Allegri brought order to last year’s confusion, partly because when players like Modric and Rabiot arrive, things inevitably change. Juventus, on the other hand, has some issues in midfield. If Tudor tonight also has to go without Thuram’s energy, the challenge becomes much […]

arts.ttl: Juventus vs. AC Milan: matchday 6 ends with a bang
arts.sum: There are 106 official previous meetings between the two teams in Turin, from the establishment of the single group to today, that is from 1929/30, with a record of 51 Juventus wins, 28 draws and 27 Milan victories. Juventus is the Serie A 2025/26 team that scores the most goals with substitute players, 4: Vlahovic (2), Adzic and Cabal (1 each).

arts.ttl: Juventus vs AC Milan – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Juventus welcome AC Milan to Turin this weekend in a highly anticipated encounter that could have implications for the Serie A title race. The two Italian giants have started the season strongly, with just one point separating Juve in fifth from Milan in first.
